p.s: I agree with the quote The limits of my language are the limits of my world, said by Ludwig Wittgenstein, a German linguist philosopher from 1889-1951, because in a globalized world you just come as far as your language skills reach.
You come way more often in contact with other cultures and other languages and it is very difficult to communicate with others if you just speaks one language.
Today some argue that you have many ways to communicate with others without having to speak the same language.
The translation possibilities are better than they were.
But so are the possibilities to learn a language.
It is way more difficult to always translate in a globalized world then to download an app and just learn a diffrentdifferent language.
When you are learning a foreign language your horizonthorizon bridens and you understand other cultures in a diffrentdifferent way.
You have way more opportunities and it even helps you in your daily life.
Many things you have not thought of before are connected to another language.
In the internet, on TVtelevision or books.
Other languages are presented in many diffrentdifferent parts of your life.
You do not have to rely on others but can read the book exactly like it is written or communicate with others without the perspective of a third one.
So I would agree with Ludwig Wittgenstein's quote especially now in a globalized world.
